availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Chelton married Sarah Ann Short on July 7, 1849. He was a farmer in Mercer County.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, “Duane Chelton (November 4, 1818-October 26, 1870),” Memorial #115741553, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=115741553 (accessed June 4, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer, District 2, p. 110; Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records ñ Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #000259310, Anderson County Marriages, p. 1.
